summary: This is an email notification from the Second Circuit Court of Appeals regarding the dismissal of Ghislaine Maxwell's appeal (case 20-3061) concerning a protective order modification. The appeal was dismissed on jurisdictional grounds, and the notification includes associated documents like the summary order and bills of cost.

persons.name: Maxwell
persons.context: Ghislaine Maxwell is the defendant in the criminal case United States v. Maxwell. Her appeal relating to a protective order modification was dismissed by the Second Circuit Court of Appeals.

persons.name: Yenni Liu
persons.context: Appears as the name associated with the electronic filing of the Bill of Cost documents in the court's system.

events.title: Maxwell's Appeal Dismissed
events.description: The United States Court of Appeals for the Second Circuit dismissed Ghislaine Maxwell's appeal (case 20-3061) relating to a protective order modification. The dismissal was on jurisdictional grounds.

keyFacts: Ghislaine Maxwell's appeal in the Second Circuit (case 20-3061) was dismissed on October 19, 2020.
The appeal specifically concerned a request for modification of a protective order in her criminal case.
The dismissal was based on jurisdictional grounds, not on the merits of her request.
The court issued a summary order and judgment, and associated bills of cost were filed.
